# performClose(_:)

**Instance Method**

Simulates the user clicking the close button by momentarily highlighting the button and then closing the window.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func performClose(_ sender: Any?)
```

## Parameters

- **sender**: The message’s sender.

## Discussion

If the window’s delegate or the window itself implements [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowDelegate/windowShouldClose(_:)], the window sends that message with the window as the argument. The window sends only one such message; if both the delegate and the window implement the method, the delegate receives the message. If the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowDelegate/windowShouldClose(_:)] method returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], the window doesn’t close. If neither the window nor the delegate implement [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowDelegate/windowShouldClose(_:)], or it returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], this method invokes [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/close()] to close the window.

If the window doesn’t have a close button or can’t close (for example, if the delegate replies [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] to a [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowDelegate/windowShouldClose(_:)] message), the system emits the alert sound.

## Related Documentation

- **styleMask**: Flags that describe the window’s current style, such as if it’s resizable or in full-screen mode.
- **performMiniaturize(_:)**: Simulates the user clicking the minimize button by momentarily highlighting the button, then minimizing the window.

## Closing Windows

- **close()**: Removes the window from the screen.
- **isReleasedWhenClosed**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the window is released when it receives the `close` message.
